subject: History
title: The Abolition Movement
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Abolition Movement usable.

hook.text: The movement to end slavery was history's first global human rights campaignâ€”and it took over a century.

buildup.text: Quakers and evangelicals in Britain began the abolition movement in the 1780s. Public opinion shifted slowly.

discovery.text: Britain banned the slave trade in 1807. Former enslaved people like Olaudah Equiano wrote memoirs that shook readers.

twist.text: After abolishing slavery in 1833, Britain paid Â£20 million to slave ownersâ€”not the enslaved. The debt lasted until 2015.

climax.text: The US abolished slavery only through civil war. Brazil, the last Western nation, ended it in 1888.

punchline.text: Freedom's debt was paid by the wrong people.

quiz.question: Who received compensation when Britain abolished slavery in 1833?
